page.title: 09BRANSCOMBE PRIMARY SCHOOL.
page.content: The school is one hundred and seven years old.When the school was opened 53 children came and in that year it rose to nearly a hundred .Mr Tomkins the vicar of Branscombe gave a site and raised some money through collections and grants to build the school. There is a school house next door but it is no longer used.Most of the children walked to school,many walking 2 miles or more.In the war times children were evacuacted from the big cities.One teacher came to Branscombe with her class of 25 children.They had their lessons in the dining room.At the moment there are 31 children in our school. We have two classes.The P.T.A.have helped the school for many years organising May Day celebrations, pancake races, bonfire parties and other fund raising functions.
